revised_title: Effects of Extracellular Sodium Concentration on Endplate Channel Characteristics
tldr: This study investigates the effects of varying extracellular sodium concentration on endplate channel characteristics in toad sartorius muscle fibers. The researchers found that endplate channel open time and conductance increased nonlinearly with decreasing sodium concentration. The results support the hypothesis that binding sites for sodium ions can modulate both channel lifetime and conductance, becoming saturated at higher sodium concentrations.
